Package kotlin.test

See:
          Description

Classes Summary
Asserter A plugin for performing assertions which can reuse JUnit or TestNG
DefaultAsserter Default implementation to avoid dependency on JUnit or TestNG
 

Function Summary
Unit assertEquals(expected: Any, actual: Any, message: String)
Asserts that the expected value is equal to the actual value, with an optional message
Unit assertFalse(actual: Boolean, message: String)
Asserts that the expression is false with an optional message
Unit assertNot(block: () -> Boolean)
Asserts that the given block returns true
Unit assertNot(message: String, block: () -> Boolean)
Asserts that the given block returns false
Unit assertNotNull(actual: Any, message: String)
Asserts that the expression is not null, with an optional message
Unit assertNull(actual: Any, message: String)
Asserts that the expression is null, with an optional message
Unit assertTrue(actual: Boolean, message: String)
Asserts that the expression is true with an optional message
Unit assertTrue(block: () -> Boolean)
Asserts that the given block returns true
Unit assertTrue(message: String, block: () -> Boolean)
Asserts that the given block returns true
<T> 
Unit
expect(expected: T, block: () -> T)
Asserts that given function block returns the given expected value
<T> 
Unit
expect(expected: T, message: String, block: () -> T)
Asserts that given function block returns the given expected value and use the given message if it fails
Unit fail(message: String)
Marks a test as having failed if this point in the execution path is reached, with an optional message
Throwable fails(block: () -> Unit)
Asserts that given function block fails by throwing an exception
<T> 
Unit
failsWith(block: () -> Unit)
Asserts that a block fails with a specific exception being thrown
Unit todo(block: () -> Any)
Comments out a block of test code until it is implemented while keeping a link to the code
to implement in your unit test output
